program_purpose_1: Provides microloans for microenterprise startups and growth through a Rural Microloan Revolving Fund
program_purpose_2: Provide training and technical assistance to microloan borrowers and micro entrepreneurs
eligible_area_criteria_1: Rural areas outside cities or towns with populations fewer than 50,000 are eligible to apply
eligible_area_criteria_2: Urbanized areas near cities of 50,000 or more may not be eligible
eligible_area_criteria_3: Borrower's headquarters can be based in a larger city as long as the project service area itself is in an eligible rural area
eligible_area_criteria_4: The lender can be located anywhere
eligible_ultimate_recipient_criteria: Businesses located in an eligible area with 10 or fewer full-time employees
mdo_requirement_1: MDOs must demonstrate experience in managing a Revolving Loan Fund
mdo_requirement_2: Certify that they or their employees have received education and training from a qualified microenterprise development training entity so that the applicant has the capacity to manage such a revolving loan fund
mdo_requirement_3: Demonstrate that they are actively and successfully participating as an intermediary lender in good standing under the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) Microloan Program or other similar loan programs as determined by the Administrator
mdo_loan_terms_reserve_fund: Must establish a loan loss reserve fund
application_process: Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis. Contact your local state office for information and to apply.
